introduction: In patriarchal Nepal, Belmaya, at 21, has given up on finding happiness. An uneducated Dalit, with an oppressive husband and baby daughter, she yearns for independence.Rewind to 2006, when she was a rebellious teenager living in a girls’ home.Grabbing the chance to learn photography,she wanted to change her world.But the home locked away her camera. I Am Belmaya follows her transformational journey from 2014 as she once again picks up the camera, this time to train as a documentary filmmaker. But are her husband and community ready for this? Struggling against violent opposition, Belmaya makes a personal film, Educate Our Daughters,which wins hearts and awards, taking her to places she never dreamed
